title: Remember the kitchen scene from Jurassic Park? Soon, you can play it
description: Jurassic Park: Survival devs say they want you to "experience the terror for yourself."
content:
Saber Interactive has released new footage from its upcoming single-player RPG, Jurassic Park: Survival. The video, which was uploaded to the official Jurassic Park: Survival YouTube channel, gives players glimpses of previously unseen footage from the game, and reveals more about the narrative and behind-the-scenes work that went into bringing its cast of prehistoric creatures — and its human protagonist — to life.

Set one day after the events of 1993's iconic Jurassic Park movie, Jurassic Park: Survival follows the story of Dr. Maya Joshi, an InGen scientist who was left behind during the evacuation of Isla Nublar. A clever girl in her own right, Maya is trapped on the island with no company aside from the island's deadly, prehistoric inhabitants. The goal is simple: Survive. But footage from the behind-the-scenes video reveals that, as Maya, players will have to navigate the island (and hopefully escape it) without ending up in the belly of the beasts roaming the park. The footage also reveals that the film's iconic velociraptor scene — in which two children are hunted through the park's kitchen facilities by a pair of deadly raptors — is something players will get to experience firsthand in Jurassic Park: Survival.

"When we were deciding how to introduce the raptors, one thing that jumped out to us was, 'What if we could make the player experience what Lex and Tim did in the kitchen?'" creative director Oliver Hollis-Leck explained. "That, and other sequences like it, are meant to put you in the shoes of those movie characters, to experience the terror for yourself."

Developers at Saber Interactive say they got up close and personal with various props, set pieces, and concept art images from the original film to ensure the game feels authentic. The video also showed off a clip in which Maya is eaten by a T. rex after failing to escape it, something Jurassic World project executive Lisa St. Armand says she can't wait to experience firsthand.

"Can't wait to come face-to-face with the T. rex," St. Armand said. "I'm going to purposely lose, so that I can get eaten by the T. rex."

Saber Interactive hasn't yet announced a release date for Jurassic Park: Survival, but has confirmed the game will launch on PlayStation 5, Windows PC, and Xbox Series X.

"We were inspired by the original film," Saber Interactive CEO Matthew Karch explained. "All the encounters are gonna be amazing, the interactions with the dinosaurs, to see them on the big screen… and it's something else when you can actually take part and interact with them in a meaningful way."

keywords.name: Jurassic World project executive Lisa St. Armand

summary: Saber Interactive has released new footage from its upcoming single-player RPG, Jurassic Park: Survival, which follows the story of Dr. Maya Joshi, an InGen scientist who was left behind during the evacuation of Isla Nublar. The game will be set one day after the events of 1993's Jurassic Park movie, with players playing a role in navigating the island and avoiding the deadly prehistoric creatures. The footage also reveals that the iconic velociraptor scene from the film is featured in the game. Developers at Saber Interactive spent close-and-personal time with props, set pieces, and concept art images from the original film to ensure the authentic experience. The release date for the game has not yet been announced.
shortSummary: Saber Interactive released new footage of Jurassic Park: Survival, depicting gameplay in a realistic, immersive setting inspired by the film's iconic kitchen scene.

Elite: Dangerous’ big fleet carrier update pushed into 2020

NBCUniversal to shut down its game publishing business
Details on how the 50-person team will be impacted are not available
Frontier Developments’ next tycoon sim is Planet Zoo, coming this fall
Following 2013’s Zoo Tycoon and last year’s Jurassic Park: Evolution
Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom’s post-credit scene makes a huge promise
Suddenly, I’m very into this franchise

An avalanche of new game announcements hit at The Game Awards 2023, ranging from the return of classic franchises to the reveals of all-new worlds. For those of you looking for a rundown of everything announced, we’ve got you covered.
Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons remake announced
Josef Fares’ critically acclaimed 2013 single-player co-op game returns with a visual overhaul, heading your way on Feb. 28, 2024.
Inscryption creator Daniel Mullins revealed Pony Island 2: Panda Circus
If Inscryption is anything to go by, describing this game based off its debut trailer feels like a fool’s errand.
The Rise of the Golden Idol announced
A follow-up to detective adventure The Case of the Golden Idol, The Rise of the Golden Idol is a bit of a mystery at the moment. But that’s the point, no?
Usual June announced
A “narrative action” game from the Finji Development Team, led by creative director Adam Saltsman, Usual June looks to feature a mix of third-person combat and adventure-game story choices.
The Odd Gentlemen revealed Harmonium: The Musical
“An accessible musical adventure,” Harmonium: The Musical stars a deaf girl in what looks and sounds like a Disney musical.
Dead Cells devs revealed their next game, Windblown
The team behind Dead Cells is back with a new game: Windblown. While the animated trailer doesn’t reveal a lot, we have more details in a preview.
Thumper dev revealed Thrasher
In what appears to be a spiritual successor to 2016 rhythm game Thumper, Thrasher looks like a wild ride through a surreal world.
Dave the Diver - Dredge announced
Dave the Diver is back in this DLC collaboration with Dredge, coming next week.
World of Goo 2 announced
2008 indie classic World of Goo is back in this sequel from 2D Boy and Tomorrow Corporation. And despite the time gap, it looks like it picks up right where the original left off.
Metaphor: ReFantazio trailer shown
The folks behind the Persona series have a new RPG on the way, and a new trailer showed a lot more of what it’s all about.
Matthew McConaughey revealed Exodus, an RPG from ex-BioWare devs
Archetype Entertainment, a new studio based in Austin, has a game in the works that resembles Mass Effect and features McConaughey’s voice.
God of War Ragnarök free DLC revealed — and it’s out next week
Sony’s Santa Monica Studio showed a trailer for God of War Ragnarök: Valhalla, “an adventure that blends God of War Ragnarök’s combat with elements inspired by the roguelike genre,” according to Game Awards host Geoff Keighley. The free DLC content is coming Dec. 12, 2023.
The Untitled Goose Game team revealed its next game, Big Walk
The team behind breakout hit Untitled Goose Game, House House, is back with an odd-looking game that seems to mix nature exploration with unusual character actions and we’re not quite sure what else. Looks fun, though!
Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown trailer shown
Ubisoft showed a new trailer for its action-heavy 2D Prince of Persia game, with that trailer noting a demo is arriving on Jan. 11, 2024, one week before the game’s Jan. 18, 2024 release date.
Ninja Theory showed a new Hellblade: Senua’s Saga trailer
Highlighting the Hellblade team’s graphical capabilities, the latest Senua’s Saga trailer gives glimpses of an intense and scary adventure, headed for release in 2024.
Unseen revealed action game Kemuri
The studio founded by former Tango Gameworks creative director Ikumi Nakamura showed a CG trailer for its first game, which has not yet been signed with a publisher.
Ori team Moon Studios revealed No Rest for the Wicked
The team behind the beautiful and punishing Ori series is back with a hack-and-slash game being published by Private Division.
Sega announces the return of Jet Set Radio, Shinobi, Golden Axe, Streets of Rage, and Crazy Taxi
In a teaser trailer showing footage from multiple games, Sega revealed glimpses of footage of new versions of many of its classic franchises.
Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero announced
The Budokai Tenkaichi series gets a visual upgrade and a new entry in the curiously named Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero.
Dead By Daylight spinoff The Casting of Frank Stone announced
From Until Dawn studio Supermassive Games comes a new single-player game set in the Dead By Daylight universe, The Casting of Frank Stone.
Square Enix announced a new Mana game
The unmistakable color palette returns in 2024 as Square Enix announced a new mainline entry in its long-running Mana series, Visions of Mana.
Rise of the Ronin release date announced
Koei Tecmo’s historical action game is coming Mar. 22, 2024, as revealed in a new trailer.
Kojima Productions teased its Xbox horror project
With a trailer showing a number of close-up faces and actor name reveals, Kojima Productions formally announced OD, the horror project that news leaked about awhile back. “It is a game, don’t get me wrong, but it’s at the same time a movie but [at] the same time a new form of media,” Kojima then said on stage, as relayed by an interpreter. Kojima also revealed that filmmaker Jordan Peele is collaborating on the project.
Jurassic Park: Survival announced
Universal announced a single-player Jurassic Park adventure game, Jurassic Park: Survival.
Black Myth: Wukong shown in new trailer
An ambitious action game from Game Science, Black Myth: Wukong evokes God of War’s sense of scale while being inspired by Chinese fantasy novel Journey to the West. The game is coming out Aug. 20, 2024.
Suicide Squad gets new trailer
The DC super-villain team-up game is still scheduled to be released on Feb. 2, 2024.
Warframe update “Whispers in the Walls” gets release date
It’s coming on Dec. 13.
Assassin’s Creed: Origins’ Bayek founded his own game studio
We typically don’t hear about game studios headed up by voice actors, but it’s a new world — and Surgent Studios’ Tales of Kenzera: Zau looks quite promising.
Don’t Nod announced Lost Records: Bloom & Rage
The Life is Strange team teased a new game due “late 2024.”
Wild action game The First Berserker: Khazan announced
Nexon’s new action game looks over-the-top.
Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth theme song revealed
In a live performance accompanied by FF7 Rebirth footage, The Game Awards orchestra played the song “No Promises To Keep” with music by Nobuo Uematsu, for the first time publicly.
Apex Legends and Final Fantasy are crossing over
To help promote Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth’s upcoming release, Square Enix’s characters will appear in Apex Legends starting Jan. 9.
Honkai: Star Rail next destination shown
See where one of the industry’s biggest breakout hits is going next.
Skull & Bones release date announced
Ubisoft’s naval action game is coming Feb. 16, 2024, with a beta on the way Dec. 15, 2023.
Arkane Lyon is making a Blade game
Marvel’s latest collaboration is with the team behind Deathloop, announced on Blade’s 50th anniversary.
Twisted Metal season 2 announced
Anthony Mackie appeared on stage to announce a second season of Peacock’s Twisted Metal TV show. No footage was shown.
Lightspeed LA announced Last Sentinel
Tencent’s Lightspeed LA studio revealed its first game, a “fully original, AAA, futuristic open-world game,” according to general manager Steve C. Martin.
The First Descendant release window announced
Impeccably timed following the debut of Last Sentinel, Nexon revealed a trailer for its upcoming sci-fi shooter The First Descendant and announced that the game will be released in Summer 2024.
Hoyoverse showed a Zenless Zone Zero trailer
The company behind Genshin Impact has a new game on the way in 2024, which Polygon previewed at Gamescom earlier this year.
10 Chambers announced Den of Wolves
The studio behind GTFO has a new sci-fi heist game in the works.
Sharkmob announced Exoborne: Master the Apocalypse
The team behind Vampire: The Masquerade — Bloodhunt has a new open-world extraction shooter.
Fallout TV show debuts new footage
We may have gotten our first look at the show recently, but here’s a bit more.
Hello Games announced Light No Fire
The creators of No Man’s Sky revealed Light No Fire, a game that studio founder Sean Murray called “the first real open world, something without boundaries.”
Simu Liu revealed new Stormgate trailer
Frost Giant’s upcoming RTS is looking good.
Elphelt Valentine is the new Guilty Gear Strive character
Your regular reminder that Strive is great and you should play it. And there’s a 3v3 mode coming in 2024!
Final Fantasy 16 DLC trailer shown
Final Fantasy 16 DLC Echoes of the Fallen is available today, while The Rising Tide is on the way in 2024.
Ex-DICE devs’ shooter The Finals is out now
Embark Studios’ over-the-top shooter showed up in a new trailer and is on sale today.
Capcom revealed Monster Hunter Wilds
Capcom is back with the latest entry in its Monster Hunter series, this one appearing to go full open-world. It’s heading for a release in 2025.

argos_summary: Saber Interactive has unveiled new footage for its upcoming single-player RPG, Jurassic Park: Survival, which is set one day after the events of the original 1993 film. Players will assume the role of Dr. Maya Joshi, an InGen scientist stranded on Isla Nublar, navigating the dangers posed by the island's prehistoric creatures. The game aims to recreate iconic scenes from the movie, including the thrilling velociraptor kitchen chase, while emphasizing player interaction with the environment and dinosaurs. A release date has yet to be announced, but the game will be available on PlayStation 5, Windows PC, and Xbox Series X.
